sentence.Network_en: Truman allowed him to stagger on for nearly another two years.
sentence.Network_cn: 杜鲁门允许他又硬撑了近两年。

sentence.Network_en: It seemed a singularly ill-judged enterprise for Truman to undertake.
sentence.Network_cn: 这对于杜鲁门来说似乎是一项特别不明智的事业。

sentence.Network_en: The disorder in military policy had its origins in Truman's first term.
sentence.Network_cn: 军事政策的混乱可追溯到杜鲁门的第一届任期。

means.word_mean: 1. elected Vice President in Roosevelt's 4th term; became 33rd President of the United States on Roosevelt's death in 1945 and was elected President in 1948; authorized the use of atomic bombs against Japan (1884-1972)
